```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(data.table)
library(ggplot2)

# read final data
dt <- fread('../../gen/analysis/temp/preclean.csv')
st <- fread('../../gen/analysis/temp/state-analysis.csv')
```

## Some rudimentary analysis in Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button in RStudio,a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. 

You can also **knit** the document from the command line, see the example in the `makefile`.


### Summary statistics

```{r}
summary(dt)
```

```{r}
summary(st)
```

### Plots

```{r}
hist(dt$polarity)
```

```{r}
# Overlaid histograms
ggplot(dt, aes(x=polarity, color=retweet)) +
  geom_histogram(fill="white", alpha=0.5, position="identity") + ggtitle('Some histogram')
```

```{r}
# tweet count in different states
# B: Blue state | R: Red state | T: Tossup state
ggplot(data=st, mapping=aes(x=state, y=tweet_cnt, fill=BR))+geom_bar(stat='identity')+geom_text(stat='identity',aes(label=tweet_cnt), vjust=1.6, color="Black", size=4.5)+scale_fill_manual(values=c("B"="blue", "R"="Red", "T"="orange"))
```{r}

```{r}
# tweet average polarity in different states
# B: Blue state | R: Red state | T: Tossup state
ggplot(data=st, mapping=aes(x=state, y=avg_polarity, fill=BR))+geom_bar(stat='identity')+geom_text(stat='identity',aes(label=avg_polarity), vjust=1.6, color="Black", size=4.5)+scale_fill_manual(values=c("B"="blue", "R"="Red", "T"="orange"))
```{r}
